DND_RACES_DATA.label: Human
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Whatever their goals, humans are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the worlds.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Elf
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it. They live in places of ethereal beauty, in the midst of ancient forests or in spires glittering with faerie light, where soft music drifts through the air and gentle fragrances waft on the breeze. Elves love nature and magic, art and artistry, music and poetry, and the good things of the world.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Dwarf
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Dwarves are known for their skill in warfare, their ability to withstand physical and magical punishment, their knowledge of the earth’s secrets, their hard work, and their capacity for drinking ale. Their kingdoms are spread across the mountains of the world, where they mine gems and precious metals and forge items of wonder.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Halfling
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Halflings are an affable and cheerful people. They cherish the bonds of family and friendship as well as the comforts of hearth and home, harboring few dreams of gold or glory. Even adventurers among them usually venture into the world for reasons of community, friendship, wanderlust, or curiosity.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Gnome
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Gnomes are welcome everywhere as technicians, alchemists, and inventors. Despite the demand for their skills, most gnomes prefer to remain among their own kind, living in comfortable burrows beneath rolling, wooded hills.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Half-Elf
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.

DND_RACES_DATA.label: Half-Orc
DND_RACES_DATA.description: Half-orcs’ grayish pigmentation, sloping foreheads, jutting jaws, prominent teeth, and towering builds make their orcish heritage plain for all to see. Whether united under the leadership of a mighty warlock or having fought their way to freedom, half-orcs are driven by a fierce determination to prove their worth.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Barbarian
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Barbarians are savage warriors from the wild frontiers, relying on their primal fury and immense strength. They are often tribal, disdainful of civilization, and fiercely independent.
Alignment: Any nonlawful.
Religion: Barbarians may revere animal spirits, nature deities, or ancestors.
Background: Often outcasts or members of nomadic tribes.
Races: Humans and half-orcs are common barbarians.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Bard
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Bards are versatile performers, weaving magic through music and words. They are storytellers, diplomats, and adventurers, often charismatic and quick-witted.
Alignment: Any nonlawful.
Religion: Bards may follow deities of art, travel, or trickery.
Background: Often from performing troupes, scholarly institutions, or simply wanderers.
Races: Humans, elves, and half-elves frequently become bards.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Cleric
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Clerics are divine agents, channeling the power of their chosen deity to heal the sick, smite the wicked, or protect the faithful. They are masters of divine magic and often serve as spiritual leaders.
Alignment: Must be within one step of their deity's alignment.
Religion: Central to their identity, clerics serve a specific deity from the pantheon.
Background: Usually trained in temples or religious orders.
Races: All races produce clerics, as faith is universal.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Druid
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Druids are guardians of the natural world, drawing power from the untamed wilderness. They can shapeshift into animals, command plants, and call upon nature's fury.
Alignment: Any neutral (Neutral Good, Lawful Neutral, True Neutral, Chaotic Neutral, or Neutral Evil).
Religion: Druids revere nature itself or specific nature deities.
Background: Often solitary hermits, members of ancient circles, or protectors of sacred groves.
Races: Humans, elves, and gnomes often feel the call of the wild.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Fighter
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Fighters are masters of martial combat, excelling with all forms of weapons and armor. They are the backbone of armies, the sellswords in taverns, and the dedicated protectors of kingdoms.
Alignment: Any.
Religion: Fighters may worship deities of war, strength, or protection, or none at all.
Background: Varied, from noble knights to grizzled mercenaries or simple village guards.
Races: All races produce skilled fighters, especially humans, dwarves, and half-orcs.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Monk
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Monks are disciplined warriors who perfect their bodies and minds to achieve extraordinary martial prowess. They eschew armor and traditional weapons, relying on their ki-powered unarmed strikes and mystical abilities.
Alignment: Must be lawful.
Religion: Monks often follow philosophies of discipline and self-perfection, sometimes tied to specific deities of law or enlightenment.
Background: Typically trained in remote monasteries.
Races: Humans are the most common monks, but any race with discipline can walk the path.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Paladin
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Paladins are holy champions of righteousness, sworn to uphold justice and smite evil. They are granted divine powers to aid their cause, including healing, protection, and the ability to turn undead.
Alignment: Must be Lawful Good.
Religion: Paladins are devoted servants of good-aligned deities.
Background: Often from noble or devout families, trained in holy orders.
Races: Humans are the most common paladins, but any creature with a pure heart can be called.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Ranger
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Rangers are skilled hunters and trackers, at home in the wilderness and adept at fighting specific types of creatures. They often possess some divine magic related to nature and an animal companion.
Alignment: Any.
Religion: Rangers often revere nature deities or gods of the hunt.
Background: Typically raised in borderlands, deep forests, or among reclusive communities.
Races: Elves, half-elves, and humans make excellent rangers.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Rogue
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Rogues are masters of stealth, trickery, and skill. They excel at disarming traps, picking locks, and striking from the shadows. They can be charming scoundrels, deadly assassins, or cunning investigators.
Alignment: Any.
Religion: Rogues often favor deities of luck, shadows, or thievery, or remain unaffiliated.
Background: From street urchins to guild thieves or spies.
Races: Halflings, elves, and humans are often drawn to the rogue's path.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Sorcerer
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Sorcerers wield arcane magic through innate talent, often stemming from draconic or fey ancestry. Their magic is intuitive and flexible, not learned through rigorous study.
Alignment: Any.
Religion: Sorcerers have varied religious beliefs, if any.
Background: Their powers often manifest unexpectedly, leading to diverse life paths.
Races: Humans and those with magical bloodlines (like half-elves with fey heritage) are common sorcerers.

DND_CLASSES_DATA.label: Wizard
DND_CLASSES_DATA.description:
Wizards are scholars of the arcane, mastering magic through intense study, research, and practice. They command a vast repertoire of spells, prepared daily from their spellbooks.
Alignment: Any.
Religion: Wizards often worship deities of knowledge, magic, or secrets, or focus purely on arcane pursuits.
Background: Typically educated in academies, mentored by master wizards, or self-taught through ancient tomes.
Races: Humans, elves, and gnomes are most commonly drawn to wizardry.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Acrobatic
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Balance and Jump checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Agile

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Alertness

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Animal Affinity
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Handle Animal and Ride checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Athletic
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Climb and Swim checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Cleave
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Make an additional melee attack after dropping an opponent.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Casting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on Concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability while on the defensive or while grappling or pinned.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Expertise
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Trade attack bonus for AC.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Combat Reflexes
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Make additional attacks of opportunity.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Deceitful
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Disguise and Forgery checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Deft Hands
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand and Use Rope checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Diligent
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Appraise and Decipher Script checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Dodge
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +1 dodge bonus to AC against a designated opponent.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Endurance
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on checks to avoid nonlethal damage from forced marches, starvation, thirst, extreme temperatures, etc.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Eschew Materials
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Cast spells without material components costing 1 gp or less.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Exotic Weapon Proficiency
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: No penalty on attacks with one exotic weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Far Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Increase range increment of ranged weapons.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Great Cleave
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Make unlimited additional melee attacks after dropping opponents.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Great Fortitude
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Fortitude saves.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Bull Rush
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on bull rush attempts, no attack of opportunity.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Counterspell
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Counterspell with spell of same school.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Critical
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Double threat range with one weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Disarm
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on disarm attempts, no attack of opportunity.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Feint
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Feint in combat as a move action.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Grapple
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on grapple checks, no attack of opportunity.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Initiative
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on initiative checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Overrun
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on overrun attempts, target cannot avoid.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Shield Bash
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Retain shield bonus to AC when shield bashing.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Sunder
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on sunder attempts, no attack of opportunity.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Trip
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 bonus on trip attempts, no attack of opportunity. Make melee attack if successful.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Gain a second attack with off-hand weapon.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Improved Unarmed Strike
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Considered armed even when unarmed.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Investigator
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Gather Information and Search checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Iron Will
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Will saves.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Lightning Reflexes
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Reflex saves.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Magical Aptitude
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Spellcraft and Use Magic Device checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Manyshot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Shoot multiple arrows as a single attack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mobility
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +4 dodge bonus to AC against attacks of opportunity from moving out of or within a threatened area.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mounted Archery
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Half penalty for ranged attacks while mounted and moving.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Mounted Combat
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Once per round, negate a hit on your mount with a Ride check.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Natural Spell
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Cast spells while in wild shape.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Negotiator
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Diplomacy and Sense Motive checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Nimble Fingers
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Disable Device and Open Lock checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Persuasive
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Bluff and Intimidate checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Point Blank Shot

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Power Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Trade attack bonus for damage (melee weapons).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Precise Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: No penalty for shooting or throwing ranged weapons into melee.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Quick Draw
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Draw a weapon as a free action.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Rapid Reload
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Reload one type of crossbow faster.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Rapid Shot
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Make an extra ranged attack.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Ride-By Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Move before and after a charge attack while mounted.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Run
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Run five times your normal speed (if wearing light or no armor) or four times speed (if wearing medium or heavy armor and carrying a medium or heavy load).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Scribe Scroll
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Create scroll of any known spell.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Self-Sufficient
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Heal and Survival checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Shield Proficiency
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: No penalty on attack rolls when using a shield.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Shot on the Run
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Move, make a ranged attack, and continue moving.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Skill Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +3 bonus on checks with one chosen skill.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +1 to save DCs for one school of magic.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Spell Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +1 to save DCs for one school of magic (stacks with Spell Focus).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Mastery
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Prepare some spells without referring to a spellbook.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spell Penetration
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on caster level checks to overcome spell resistance.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Spell Penetration
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on caster level checks to overcome spell resistance (stacks with Spell Penetration).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spirited Charge
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Double damage on a mounted charge.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Spring Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Move, attack, and then move again.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Stealthy
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on Hide and Move Silently checks.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Stunning Fist
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Stun opponent with an unarmed strike.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Toughness
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +3 hit points.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Track
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Use Survival skill to track.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Trample
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Overrun opponents while mounted.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Two-Weapon Defense
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +1 shield bonus to AC when fighting with two weapons.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Two-Weapon Fighting
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Reduce penalties for fighting with two weapons.

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Weapon Finesse

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Weapon Focus
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +1 bonus on attack rolls with one chosen weapon (stacks with Weapon Focus).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Weapon Specialization

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Greater Weapon Specialization
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: +2 bonus on damage rolls with one chosen weapon (stacks with Weapon Specialization).

DND_FEATS_DATA.label: Whirlwind Attack
DND_FEATS_DATA.description: Attack all adjacent opponents.
